content.raw:
The upstream Eigen3 project installs a `Eigen3Config.cmake` file (i.e. they refer to the CMake package as `Eigen3`) and since [Eigen 3.3.1](https://bitbucket.org/eigen/eigen/src/f562a193118d4f40514e2f4a0ace6e974926ef06/cmake/Eigen3Config.cmake.in?at=3.3.1&fileviewer=file-view-default#Eigen3Config.cmake.in-6) a relocatable `Eigen3::Eigen` is exported .

There is any specific reason for choosing instead `EIGEN3` as cmake package name and `EIGEN3::EIGEN3` as target name? 

Old but related issue in `ros/cmake_modules` : https://github.com/ros/cmake_modules/issues/25 .
content.html:
The upstream Eigen3 project installs a Eigen3Config.cmake file (i.e. they refer to the CMake package as Eigen3) and since Eigen 3.3.1 a relocatable Eigen3::Eigen is exported .

There is any specific reason for choosing instead EIGEN3 as cmake package name and EIGEN3::EIGEN3 as target name?

Old but related issue in ros/cmake_modules : https://github.com/ros/cmake_modules/issues/25 .
